text: Myles P. Dyer (August 3, 1887 – September 1, 1969) was an American Democratic politician who served in the Missouri General Assembly. He served in the Missouri Senate from 1939 until 1943. Born in Cleveland, Ohio, Dyer was educated in parochial and public schools and at Benton College of Law in St. Louis, Missouri. ==References== ==External links== * The Political Graveyard: Index to Politicians, Dyer Category:1887 births Category:1969 deaths Category:20th-century American politicians Category:Missouri Democrats Category:Missouri state senators
title: Myles P. Dyer
